Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: Jessica F
Reviews.Content: The "hotel" is more like a remodeled motel. The rooms are comfortable and cute, and the shower was fantastic! The walls are really thin and the staff is nice but by no means great. It was a good value in a great location. It is a block from the Westside Pavilion, movies, good restaurants, etc. The parking lot is small and a little tough to maneuver in, but it was off-street parking none-the-less. The place was average, but it was clean and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER EVER EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Christina C
Reviews.Content: Booked through the hotel and told them we had three guests. All 3 of us checked in with the manager who brought our bags to the room and saw us go in and out of the hotel for 3 days. The morning of the 4th day we went to get our "breakfast", which was a piece of toast and a cup of coffee just to get informed by a RUDE woman that breakfast was over at 9:30...it was 9:31!!!!!!!!!!!!! After an exchange of words she remarked that she needed to speak to one of the guests in the room so we approached the front desk for her to tell us that they were charging us an extra $40 for having an extra guest! Not only did we confirm when we booked, the manager himself never told us even when we checked in and signed the invoice without any extra charge!!! From that point on they were completely rude and ignorant even when we walked by and said hello to the point that we checked out early because we no longer felt safe!! They refused to refund our money and fraudulently charged us for the extra person, WITHOUT OUR APPROVAL!!!!!!!! When we asked to speak to the manager they said the manager was unavailable and after persisting they said they would not deal with this further and that nobody wanted to deal with us or help our situation!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You will not sleep.”
Reviews.Author: statnancy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the L.A. Sky boutique hotel February 12 and 13th of 2012. It is located among strip malls on a busy street. The building is basically an old cheap motel remodeled and decorated to appear like a chic boutique hotel but they missed a few elements. The parking lot looks sketchy. You can hear EVERY noise from your neighbors' rooms, as well as every step and conversation in the courtyard (your room door is directly in the courtyard). I arrived Sunday night for a job interview Monday morning, and was awakened in the middle of the night by a loud group of party goers. In the early morning I could hear my neighbor snoring, then using the bathroom, blowing his nose etc. etc. The room was nicely decorated and of good size with a comfortable bed. The bathroom nice and good size also. I would recommend looking at other hotels in the area that did not cost too much more.

Reviews.Title: “NIcely redone!”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Sky Hotel basically because the price fit our budget for the night. The beach hotels wanted $650/night which was ridiculous seeing as we only wanted to sleep! I was concerned as we drove up to the hotel and saw that it was only 2 stories, with basically no big signs telling you where to turn or where to park. The hotel is basically an old motel which was redone very nicely. There is a nice "verandah" type area in the middle of the hotel (which used to be the outside patio for a 2 story motel. It has a nice sitting area with beautiful chandeliers hanging down, and the top is completely covered with nice fabric. I was worried when I walked through the verandah to see that the rooms were all accessible from the stairs/balcony. When we arrived in the room, we were very pleasantly surprised. The room was redone VERY nicely with bright, modern colors. We definitely felt like we were at a "boutique" style hotel. The bed was perhaps the most comfortable bed my husband and I have slept on in a long time, and we travel often. What would have made this hotel a 4 star instead of a 3 star? There was a coffee machine, but no coffee. The towels were too thin/cheap looking and our bath mat was basically a hand towel. The enclave which held the refrigerator needed repainting on the bottom. There was paint chipping off and it made it look old. I would put something on top of the refrigerator to lighten up that area and hide the scratch marks on the refrigerator. Besides that, the room was very clean and the bathroom facilities were new and up to date. The location is great also! Walking distance to the Westside Pavilion. Yes, the walls are a bit thin, but I never heard anything all night (Saturday) because the bed literally kept me asleep!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place!”
Reviews.Author: Karin W
Reviews.Content: Coming to LA for the third time, I have been at other hotels such as the Angelino and the nearby Travel Lodge, which were all OK - nothing more. The Sky really stood out to me because of the cleanliness of the place, the high quality beds and bedding, and the hotel's great location (it is located across the street from Juniors, one of the most famous delis in Los Angeles, and down the street from a luxurious mall). I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a quiet and relaxing stay! Be sure to talk to whomever is working at the front desk - they are all extremely nice and helpful with a good sense of humor too! Overall the experience left a great impression on me and I will definitely be coming back very very soon! FIVE STARS to SKY!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but noisy...”
Reviews.Author: KimberleyLewis
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute, and the rate here was really good ($162) considering location, etc. The room was great... comfortable bed, , good-size bathroom...but the outer walls were thin, and at night you could hear everyone walk by your room, which wasn't conducive to a good night's sleep. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and there is access to a computer + free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: ystavitsky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night when visiting family in California. Really great location, super close to everything in LA. We had a car, which you need in LA, and everywhere we went was relatively close. Room was really clean, great modern furniture. The bed was very comfortable. After an entire day of running around, decided to lay down and could barely get up before going out for the night. The little courtyard was really cute. Only complaint, cold coffee. :) All in all, a great stay for a couple in their 20's.

Reviews.Title: “It's just ok”
Reviews.Author: jo c
Reviews.Content: This hotel scared me after reading all of the negative reviews. What I will say is that it really isnt that bad considering it is a 3star and all... The rooms have been "redecorated" the look fine the furniture is new, beds are comfortable, location is good well to Beverly hills if you have a car. I'm not entirely sure if you would call this hotel a boutique hotel or a refurbished motel.. We didn't have a window in our room well looking on to outside, instead we had one the people could walk past see in plus it looked out onto a closed in communal courtyard. We found our self not really using this window.... The room was freshly painted and clean. One negative is that the rooms are paper thin you can hear people in the courtyard... Maybe they need double glazed windows here. The staff were friendly very accomadating. Our room included a breakfast. We used this once not the best selection. Plus they don't cater for people with dairy intolerance ie soy milk... The staff member who looks after breakfast is really lovely... What I will say with there terms and conditions it says no cancelations / only modifications disregard this no anything... We tried to modify our room and the manager would not allow this. Over all this was fine. We didn't experience bed bugs.. Oh and be prepared to pay $15 a day for SELF PARKING I'm not intyrely sure if this sort of motel should be charging this...

Reviews.Title: “Complete dump”
Reviews.Author: KG1977_11
Reviews.Content: First of all - the name "Sky Hotel" is a misnomer, as my room did not have a window to the outside, and therefore no view of anything vaguely sky-like. Second: not clean - hand print on walls, urine stain on bathroom floor. (At least I hope it was urine. Shudder to think of other possibilities) Third: No window to the outside, just a window to an indoor atrium. This means you either have privacy but stay in a closet, or have some natural light/fresh air, and share your experience with everyone walking in and out of the hotel. Four: They are about making money at the expense of treating customers well. Because there was no room with a window to the outside for me to move into (because I suspect they don't have any!), I moved out after only 2 days, but had pre-paid for 5. After multiple phone calls, I was refused even a PARTIAL refund for the other 3 nights. This place is in fact a converted motel. And yes, the furniture is new and nice, but a hotel room without a window you can use is actually a glorified closet. Given the complete absence of customer service and the uncomfortable room, I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. There are many charming and comfortable 3.5 star hotels that did not start life as a motel in the nearby area, do your research, stay in one of them instead.

Reviews.Title: “They don't honor reservations”
Reviews.Author: p w
Reviews.Content: A friend is coming into town tomorrow. She reserved a room for 5 days at this place on my recommendation. I've had other people stay there before and like it. She called to confirm today and after having received a confirmation email about her stay when she made the reservation, the supposed manager told her that the reservation had been cancelled (no idea how) and that there were no rooms available. She was very rude and unhelpful and told my friend she was going to have to find a room somewhere else. A kind of "tough luck" attitude. Clearly someone on her end had made a mistake because we have the confirmation of the reservation, which had never been cancelled. Obviously there are other hotel rooms in town, but this was friendly for her budget and a good location. So, be forewarned, that this place clearly doesn't honor their reservations. Who knows what the true story is...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a touch of old Hollywood charm!”
Reviews.Author: DJB27
Reviews.Content: Great value place with the mose comfortable bed i've EVER slept in. The rooms are finished beautifully and the contintental breakfast in the sitting area in the morning has a very old world hollywood charm about it. The staff were wonderfully friendly and helpful - even for late night requests. It was lovely to come back after a day out and about and have someone remember who you were (not like at the bigger hotels). Located conveniently between Hollywood, Westwood and Santa Monica with food and shopping close by.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Tamela81
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly and helpful during our stay. This was my parents 1st trip to LA from Australia and they had 2 days to before my arrival (an ex-LA person). The staff helped them with so many things and went out of their way. The location of the hotel is perfect for easy access to Santa Monica and Downtown LA. We used public transport to get around and it was very easy to access and quick. The room I was in needed painting however was very functional and served the purpose. The beds were super comfortable which is a definate plus. A few minor cleaning issue's with each of our rooms however the rooms were clean which is the main thing. We heard no traffic noise from Westwood Blvd which was amazing considering the location. We would all definately stay here again and as a Hotel Front Office Manager I would also recommend it to ther travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug Alert”
Reviews.Author: muckyduck1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days and found bedbugs and evidence of bedbugs in both of our rooms. The first one had brownish stains around the corners of the mattress (one of the signs of bedbugs) and on awakening in the second one, we had welts on our backs and arms. I actually ended up throwing away our suitcases and most of the clothes that we took on our trip. If you have read up on bedbugs, you know that once they get in your house, they are there to stay and only very expensive treatments can get rid of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, away from the action.”
Reviews.Author: SteveStefan
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is located away from all the action, itâ€™s only a short (10min) bus ride to Santa Monica. So if you are keen to go to the beach or to down-town Santa Monica, but don't want to spend too much $$$, then this is a great hotel. The room I had was very spacious, wonderful decor (as shown on their website), very comfortable bed and everything was in great order. Although I thought the internal courtyard would be noisy, it certainly wasnâ€™t. The staff were very friendly and happy to help out. It is however a shame that most of the windows face the courtyard and first-floor walkways and donâ€™t have sheer curtains to allow the guests to open the drapes without being seen by passersby. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, great service and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: From-an-Israeli-Scot
Reviews.Content: Room was very spacious and nice, location was perfect. The customer service was very friendly and overall a great stay and highly recommended. Only down point was very poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cute on the outside, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: ejbf
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked (online) one queen bed, for one night at the Sky Boutique Hotel. Almost from the start the experience was unpleasant. I found our check in rather curt with no greeting, verifying the accuracy of our reservation, and when I tried to give the front desk clerk a $20 bill, for the $15 parking fee, he responded flatly, "I don't have change." After he went about his business silently, he found a $5 in his own pocket and kind of tossed it my way. When we opened the door to our room, we saw (what we assumed was a mistake) two queen beds. We had specifcally booked one queen bed online, so my fiance went down stairs to speak to the front desk clerk about the mix up. He told us that we actually got an "upgrade" and that was all they had. Once we tried pointing out to him that we did not book two queen beds, nor did we want a room with two beds in it, the front desk clerk (never got his name because nobody wore name tags) said there was a room with one king bed, but that would cost us a $30 upgrade fee. Once again I questioned why we should be the ones to pay to fix their mistake. He kept saying it was "policy." I asked for a manager, and was told one would not be in until the morning. I left the situation feeling very unsettled... After the room debacle I had some friends stop by for a glass of wine before we went out to dinner, which we tried to enjoy in the courtyard because the AC in our room did not work, and it was HOT. The same desk clerk that was EXTREMELY rude and unhelpful before sat (in plain view) at the bar and watched t.v. with his feet up. In the morning I spoke with (again, no name tag) someone who said they were the front-desk manager. I explained the room situation, and again, I was hit with "policy." What that policy is/was was never really made clear. Their unexplainable "policy" aside, the lack of courtesy was astounding to me. I've sent a letter to the manager, but from reading the other reviews, that does not seem like it will make much of an impact....stay far away.

Reviews.Title: “great location ,great price, great service,”
Reviews.Author: brian-d-antonio
Reviews.Content: great location ,great price, great service, we came to our yearly vacation in los angeles The staff was extremely helpful. We had many questions, and they answered all of them willingly and well. There were no troubles with Wi-Fi, so we had Internet access like a dream. The exterior of many adjoining buildings was very beautiful, over all Westwood CA is a very nice place â€¦ he entire inside of the hotel building was very nice. The location was quite good. A couple short blocks away, the bus was available (or you can cal la taxi). Overall, we're very satisfied. We will stay there again, and we would recommend it highly to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but it could be loud if there are inconsiderate guests”
Reviews.Author: kmbkmb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a really nicely redone motel with a central courtyard. The rooms are quite nice looking, although ours didn't have any outer facing windows, and I could see why other people have complained about noise - we were lucky and had quiet people staying near us but you could tell the walls were very thin.

Reviews.Title: “Motel fakes Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AletheaTravels
Reviews.Content: The rooms really are nicely and newly decorated but what their website doesn't show you is the hideous profusion of fake flowers in the courtyard, the jarringly bad paintings out of sync with the newer furnishings, and the overall look of a half-renovated 70's motel. In a word, their decorating scheme is schizophrenic. Needless to say it was embarrassing to have any of my business contacts meet me at the hotel. Add to that, that my door wouldn't lock, my phone wouldn't make outgoing phone calls, my television remote had nearly-dead batteries, their "wifi" required my laptop to be wired to their internet wall outlet to work like old dial-up connections, and zero view from both of the two rooms I had. The "fitness center" is a small, sad, dingy room with a few old pieces of exercise equipment. The place had the feeling of a youth hostel with casual young staff that gave indifferent service. I wouldn't mind if the price were lower and the website made all this clear, or conversely to pay more if the problems were fixed before my arrival. But asking for $170 or so a night for that level of quality was poor value and I felt deceived. By contrast, I found another small hotel in a much better part of town, with a better view, a brand new, bigger room with truly chic decor, with real wireless wifi, with beautiful reception, lounge, and halls, complementary Friday night cocktails, a pool, sauna, and a larger fitness center, with professional staff for only $50 more. I told them I would come into town regularly on business and they bent over backwards to set up a corporate account for me with all the perks. I'm staying there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Love it ! one osthe best LA vacation i had in years”
Reviews.Author: kim20011
Reviews.Content: me and my husband stayed there for the weekend. The room was beautiful, the views were really nice, the restaurants around the hotel were amazing ! food and overall, the experience was great. The hotel is highly customer service friendly. the maid service was great fast just the way we like it, and the wake up call all worked out great, and they went well above and beyond what I ever expected them to do,they were polite, helpful, and so professional that we were blown away. This place will treat you like royalty and make sure they do EVERYTHING in their power to ensure you are fully satisfied with your stay. This hotel is an amazing experience, and I'm so grateful to their well trained staff for making our stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE”
Reviews.Author: amyproost
Reviews.Content: This hotel really had all the charm of a home away from home. Staff was great, friendly and very accommodating. The rooms were modern, new with large flat screen tvs and the most comfortable bedding. Location was perfect, I was within walking distance to the best shopping mall and great restaurants. This boutique hotel is truly a MUST, exceptional overall experience...can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad rude costumer service”
Reviews.Author: Zuzu411
Reviews.Content: Very bad rude customer service. We reserved a room with two queen beds a month in advance over the phone. We got there they said there was no double queen rooms available and stuck us in a room with one king bed and a pull out twin couch. When we reserved the room we told them the number of occupants would be four. They did not tell us the rate was based on double occupancy. They just expected us to know and said it was on their website. They charged us for the extra occupants. I asked if they had parking when making the reservation and they said yes there is parking, but they did not tell us it was extra. They charged our credit card twice accidentally making us nervous and adding the extra hassle of getting money put back on the card. The bed was dirty and I itched all night.. They made no apologies to us and were infect very arrogant and rude. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty on the surface but don't expect much sleep”
Reviews.Author: Aussiefemaletravelle
Reviews.Content: I booked online because this hotel offered decent rates compared to other LA hotels. My room was quite cute, but there was no full-length mirror and no safe. Bed was comfy but walls were thin - I was woken up/kept awake by neighbours snoring, walking around above me, people talking in the courtyard and what sounded like an alarm which went for TWO HOURS one morning. Also, my room was on the courtyard so I couldn't open the curtains without people seeing right in. So I couldn't have any natural light in my room. I'd suggest they replace curtains with blinds, so people can have light AND privacy. And improve the insulation between walls and ceilings. On the plus side, the staff were generally friendly. The breakfast was simple but the service was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place - the level of service is horrible!”
Reviews.Author: girl095
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. If you want friendly and efficient service, do no stay here

Reviews.Title: “Neat Hotel close to Shopping”
Reviews.Author: labell9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sky Hotel while visiting family and attending a movie screening in the nearby shopping center. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Decor was a nice change from the standard hotel room. The lobby has a wine / espresso bar that is self serve pay by the bottle. We received a special room rate and were advised that once booked no cancellation allowed. We had a comfortable stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: Threeteaspoons
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel and found bed bugs, so asked to be moved to another room (I understand that you don't need to leave a hotel if there are bed bugs in one room). There were no room available, so the desk clerk said they could credit my payment back and I left to stay at another hotel. I can't get my money back and the manager cannot be reached.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre hotel- crazy, wretched customer relations.”
Reviews.Author: sunnysideslim
Reviews.Content: i 'm a frequent visitor to l.a. and i generally stay at the palomar or the w in westwood. neither hotel had a room the night i needed so i ended up at the sky hotel. the parking lot is awkward, the room was small, the bathroom tiny. there is a common open lobby where the other guests can be heard.- don't expect to get much sleep. overall, it is overpriced and cheesy. the thing that takes the sky hotel from being merely mediocre into the "beyond atrocious" category is the insanely rude and demented treatment i received after getting my visa bill. in addition to the agreed upon billing for the room, i noticed a $50 charge. i called the hotel and left a message, which was not returned. when i finally reached an individual there- "iris"- i was told that the $50 was for a bathrobe i had taken from the room. i explained that i had not taken any bathrobe and that the charge needed to be reversed. she insisted that i had taken the robe, no matter how many times i told her that i had not. i pointed out that i am too tall to wear any "one size fits all" item and that i had not even seen the robe. she didn't offer to question the cleaning staff or speak to management or acknowlege that they may have erred. when i raised my voice and got angry (i'm not fond of being called a thief and a liar) , she said that was proof that i had stolen the bathrobe and she wasn't going to do a thing and hung up. my credit card company is helping me get my $50 back, but this was such unacceptable behavior by a business that i had to share the experience. one star is too good for this joint.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible greedy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sevenlover
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation for 3 days but changed the plan to stay just one night, asked the hotel staff to cancel 2 days of stay and said they said it was OK to cancel but they charged for 3 days anyway. I tried to contact the manager to refund the money but they had a really bad attitude and brushed off. So greedy and not a comfortable room as the picture. Don't get fooled by the nice pictures, they are not friendly at all. Also hotel wasn't booked, they were empty, I wonder nobody stay this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NicolaAlpe
Reviews.Content: The Sky Hotel was an excellent place to stay whilst in LA. We were in a large suite and it was wonderful - the best bed and linen I have experienced in a hotel in a long time! I was travelling for work with my boyfriend and we both loved it. We had a rental car so the location didn't matter much and loved the MExican restaurant just down the road. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “cute, friendly, reasonable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: spm203
Reviews.Content: Several members of my family, aged 16 to 84, stayed at the Sky recently. The staff was great. The rooms modern and clean. I slept well. Free wifi and breakfast. Only improvement would be better bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MirageLady
Reviews.Content: This is an older building that has been refurbished very nicely so that it's very stylish. The tented courtyard is a delightful place to sit and enjoy breakfast. Fixtures are modern, good quality. The staff is great - very helpful in every regard. The only complaint I have is the pillows. If they are down, or something to simulate down, they are too soft and don't really offer any support for one's head if lying down or back if sitting up. It was also a little farther from UCLA than I thought - more like 3 miles but it's very accessible to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, comfortable boutique hotel with parking!”
Reviews.Author: michkab16
Reviews.Content: My daughter was planning on moving to LA, and we needed a base for our apartment search. The lobby was inviting, with the coffee, breakfast options, and seating to read the paper or watch TV. The atrium in the center of the hotel was adorable, and I liked it very much. The rooms were comfortable, the parking was so convenient, the price was reasonable, and it was a perfect place to stay for a few days. I would go back again, and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “This beautiful and serene Hotel with the welcoming, helpful staff make your stay so enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: cruisingabout
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, within a very short walk to amazing shopping and restaurants. The Lobby and grounds and rooms are so beautifully decorated and maintained, and it's so comfortable to relax there. All the staff are so friendly and helpful, you feel so welcomed. The whole place is immaculate, and the rooms are so beautiful and comfortable. We so enjoyed our stay, and you will, too.

Reviews.Title: “Centraly Located in Los Angeles, I had a great time,”
Reviews.Author: happydad2010
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business meeting, the hotel was quite and clean, I would come back there in the future and would recommend it in a heartbeat !

Reviews.Title: “trendy boutique hotel in a central location - close to HW10”
Reviews.Author: badkao
Reviews.Content: For west LA... this hotel was a bargain. about a 5 min drive to westwood/UCLA area. 10 min drive to Santa Monica on the 10 HW. The rooms and hotel lobby were nicely decorated. The owner, an Isreali lady, was very friendly and striked up a conversation with us...and had no problem accommodating us when we had to cancel one of the nights because our friends invited us up to Santa Barbara for one night. We stayed for 6-7 nights and paid around 200 usd/night. Free parking and free internet. we had a rental car and i brought my own laptop. Breakfast was good. Short walking distance to a mall.

Reviews.Title: “A great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Curly1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sky Hotel for 4 nights and couldn't have ended up at a better place for recovering from a long flight, crossing many timezones. The room was quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable, we woke up rested every day. The hotel staff is very friendly and we enjoyed our breakfast at Junior's just across the road. Choosing a hotel from the other side of the world is always a bit of a gamble, but we couldn't have picked a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Manager-Never ever give them your Visa C#”
Reviews.Author: Swimchum
Reviews.Content: Read all other reviews before booking in this hotel. They charge my Visa Card without my consent. Manager is a very rude and ignorant person. I never checked in and I was charged for the total stay... I will take them to court and get my Money.. This is a small Motel with no customer service experience... when there is a problem or concern, they leave you alone....

Reviews.Title: “A very different hotel”
Reviews.Author: maurzzzz
Reviews.Content: Reminding one of a former motel changed into a hotel, by someone with a flair for design, it is unique. It really is a hotel/motel. Spotless throughout, one expects to see Gretta Garbo, walk down the "inside stairs". The location is great and within walking distance to a mall. I would have preferred a larger sink area, as everything has to be placed on the edge. The inside court, is not really that inviting and could use some changes. The furnishings throughout are funky and wonderful, looked liked the had been purchased yesterday. My room was equpped with a space heater, which I really don't trust, and was a little worried about keeping it on. The staff was exceptional....Priced fairly

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in LA, have a real fun !”
Reviews.Author: james_wilson10000
Reviews.Content: Great Location in LA, have a real fun ! myself and wife came down from mountain View to our small vacation in Los Angels and could not ask for a cooler hotel, nice quite yet centrally located in Los Angeles walking distance from all the right places (rare in LA) really happy we found this hotel, would come back in our next visit in town. James.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel at a great Los Angeles Location,”
Reviews.Author: david2010-5
Reviews.Content: nice hotel at a great Los Angeles Location, will return gladly, David.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experiance of my life”
Reviews.Author: Ves12
Reviews.Content: My company had paid for the room and the hotel had the company card on file. Upon check-in I was told to present a card â€œjust in case of extra chargesâ€�. I did present a personal Check card, as I did not anticipate and did not acquire any additional charges. I specifically asked the person at the front desk if my card will be charged and he replied â€œno, unless you charge something extraâ€�. On check-out I was given a receipt for the total charge without identifying where the funds come from. Naturally I assumed that was the receipt for the hotel charge that should have occurred 10 days before. Subsequently, I found out that my personal card was charged for the amount. Since this is the card I use to pay bills with, now I am absorbing NSF charges from my bank for payments Iâ€™ve made. When I called I was refused access to Management by the employee at the front desk. She admitted that mistake was made by the person who checked me out, but refuse to remedy the situation promptly and told me she will attend to this at the end of her shift. That was clearly unacceptable for me and when I asked again to speak to a Manager, she hung-up the phone and did not pick-up for the next several times I tried to call. I am profoundly disappointed by the service and treatment I received. My experience was badly tainted by this incident. I would never return, there is a complete lack of accoutability and resposability. Worst staff ever.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sky LA has a great location for its price”
Reviews.Author: cessargor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sky LA has a great location for its price. The room and bathroom were truly clean and the housekeeping staff very polite. Our room was roomy â€¦.. J go figure but we could manage. The service at Reception was great the personnel know the surroundings of the hotel in and out , and what's happening. Otherwise they were very friendly, Just to let you know: there is a very good cafÃ© and internet

Reviews.Title: “Personal & friendly service, quiet, Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: ben22222
Reviews.Content: stayed at the sky hotel LA when I was in town on a conversation in century city, place was really nice and classy, outstanding personal service , would come back there on my next visit to Los Angeles with my wife undoubtedly. ben.

Reviews.Title: “Always make you feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: mousieCa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times over the past four years while being treated at UCLA Medical Center. The rooms are always spotless and very quiet. Irit is always very helpful and seems to have a place a us. It is only a couple of blocks from shopping and movies. The beds are so comfortable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Torture on the First Floor, Party Upstairs”
Reviews.Author: zoler
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to review this hotel because, in our experience, it largely depends on the room. We had purchased one of the cheapest rooms they had, which turned out to be a somewhat cramped cave-like room with no natural light (although there was a window onto the dim courtyard where everyone walks by). It took about 5 minutes to realize that the walls of this "cave" were paper thin and we could make out our neighbors' conversation and what show they were watching on tv, not to mention the noise of the people above us. They were rather loud neighbors, but it was evident that any neighbors who weren't pretty much mute would've been a problem. It took 5 more minutes to figure out the wi-fi internet didn't work (we had to get a ethernet cable from mgmt.) After letting the mgmt. know about the noise and having to go buy earplugs, we made it through the night, planning to move hotels first-thing the next day. When we talked to the management in the morning, they offered to upgrade us to a room upstairs which was quite nice - plush bed and stylish decor (as before), but this time spacious and with a window on the street (double-paned for noise reduction). It was pretty much smooth sailing from there, with no more neighbor problems. The only other "issue" being a middle-of-the-night trip to the bathroom, where I could hear a woman with a southern accent talking on the phone, and again, so clearly that I could make out parts of the conversation. Would I recommend it? It all depends on the room. And who your neighbors are. And what you're paying for it. ...So maybe (which is not an option on TripAdvisor).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: GR8couple
Reviews.Content: What a great escape from the norm. My wife and I have stayed here several times over the last couple years and we keep coming back. We just love to stay there for a night, or two, to enjoy the hotel and it's surrounding neighborhood. I've already booked our stay for April. I felt compelled to reassure anyone else reading the poor reviews that this hotel is truly FABULOUS.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for...never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: kayzie08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sky Hotel for one night. We could hear everything going on in the next room ( and they weren't loud) therefore, did not gt muchsleep and the smell from the new plastic on the head board of the bed make us feel sick. The rooms have only one small window that looked out into the closed courtyard and everyone walks by your window. This hotel should be advertised as motel. Management would not refund us for the the following nights that we were supposed to stay, actually the general manager was rude. Don't be fooled by the pictures on the internet or dragged in by their promotiona rates.... and just a response to the hotel saying these bad reviews are not true... this is true! Never again !

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfied”
Reviews.Author: jkmdread
Reviews.Content: I stayed one rainy Friday night at the Sky hotel in Westwood. At check-in I was charged an additional $20 on top of my room rate without any explanation. Only after asking was I told it was for self parking ($10) and breakfast ($10). I opted out of the meager sounding breakfast and had a much more economical (and undoubtedly more satisfying) meal across the street. My room was small but the bed was very comfortable, although only one pillow was provided. The bathroom toilet would not fully flush, which, unfortunately, I realized in the middle of the night. But the worst part, was the thin walls in this particular room. I could hear every word of a 15 minute conversation that took place after 1am in the neighboring room. This was a normal conversation - no shouting. The night I stayed, there was some college students staying in the upstairs rooms, so from 10 pm to 10:30 as they were getting ready to go out, I felt like I was at a frat party. After about 20 minutes of this I called the front desk to complain. In summary - my room had MAJOR sound proofing and plumbing issues. After a night of little sleep I complained to the staff the next morning, but was not given any credit. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: eliza111
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, last minute, as our departure plans changed. We were able to get a very nice room, extremely clean, comfortable and cozy. I'm sure I'd stay again, as long as the price is right. In this economic climate, there are a lot of bargains to be found, which is a real break for the budget minded traveller.

Reviews.Title: “I loved Sky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dafnee
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect, I usually stay at four to five stars hotels, but with todays economy I have decided to book a weekend at a small hotel. I have heard from a friend about sky hotel, that it is a nice small boutique hotel with a very personal treatment. So I decided to try it. When I called the hotel the woman on the phone was very nice and informative, She described the hotel exactly as my friend did. A charming jewel in the middle of town, and the price was too good to turn it down. So I took a chance and I must say that I am very happy I did. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, and they made me feel at home. The rooms were clean and decorated in very good taste. I am not a big eater in the morning and the light breakfast was perfect for me. Over all I must say that I like staying at this hotel more than some of the large hotels I have stayed in before. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A closet with brown water and hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: past-nomad
Reviews.Content: The only reason this place is getting 2 stars is because of the bed. It was ridiculously comfortable. My wife and I had 5 bags and although there were 2 people at the desk (not with customers) no one helped us. They had a few hidden charges when we checked in- parking (which they removed since we didn't have a car) and breakfast. In retrospect i would have been much happier having the breakfast across the street. We got to our room (unassisted) and found that it was tiny. We booked a superior room online, but apparently that didn't mean much. I went out and asked if the room was infact 'superior' and was assured that it was. There was only one towel in the room, one bath robe, and brown water coming from the shower. I asked for a new towel and robe and they brought a robe without a belt. no towel. The hotel has a motel 8 feel with nice furniture and boutique prices. It feels like i'm forgetting something, so just dont stay there unless location and bed comfort are all that matter to you. I think all the 5 star ratings must have come from the owner or employees.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice, Small Hotel in West Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Blessington
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is nearly in Westwood Village and it is convenient to all of West Los Angeles. We stayed for three nights and were pleased with the quality of service and the room decor. We definitely recommend it to anyone looking for reasonably priced, comfortable accommodations. The rooms are somewhat odd in that most of them only have windows into an enclosed courtyard. But the air conditioning is quiet and mostly unobtrusive and the rooms are pleasantly decorated with comfortable beds. The courtyard and lobby have a European "small hotel" feeling with a self-service coffee bar and snacks all day and a very well-presented breakfast buffet in the mornings. The only negative would be a disinterested, semi-hostile front desk clerk, but it's easy to avoid him. So, all in all a good choice for a few days in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely private boutique Hotel near UCLA, Westwood with Mjor Shopping”
Reviews.Author: dqmehr
Reviews.Content: A little boutique hotel convient to Westwood and UCLA near Culver City with major shopping. Attentive to details and comfort. Lovely decorating. Comfort bedding! Beautiful details in the materials used for accomadations. Upscale, upbeat, contemporary. Quiet and private. Expect personal parking area that is narrow but adequate. The minus of nightlights in rooms, extra counter space and adequate lighting in bathrooms with towels for more than one; luggage racks and adequate in room coffee and access, should not discourage you if you ask for what you need. The owners and management are more than accommodating. There are other ammenties in hotel and rooms to free the traveler from stress and provide service of comfort and privacy. This boutique hotel opened in April 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome small boutique hotel!!! Kudos from San Diego to the Sky Hotel Team!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoSandiegan1
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and I can tell you that this hotel is by far the nicest one that I have stayed while in LA for business reasons. The price and the location are just perfect! No parking fee, free breakfast, fast Wireless connection, beautiful plasma screen TV with a beautifully decorated clean room, and I found this hotel to be safe. Being a young woman, and have stayed there all the nights by myself, safety is very important to me. I have recommended this hotel to all of my co- workers and they all agreed that this hotel is an awesome deal. The Staff is beyond helpful and caring. I have been coming to this cute hotel every week for almost two months now, and I wouldn't change it. From day one, I have been treated with respect and courtesy by all the Staff members. I kick myself for have stayed in other hotels before I found this gem. My special compliments and sincere thanks to Rafael, one of the Front Desk Clerks. He has gone above and beyond to assist me with a smile in his face, always. Nicholas, another Front Desk Clerk, has also been helpful. Keep up the good work, Sky Hotel Team!

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Sarahsanfran
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business and pleasure. This was by far the worst, most unprofessional staff I have ever experienced. I came back to my room around 8 pm on a cold and rainy night and my heater didn't work. The only person working was the front desk guy who couldn't fix it. I asked for more blankets and was given sheets. I told him to write it in the manager's log and have someone contact me about a refund. No one contacted me and after several calls and threats to contact the Better Bus. Bureau, I finally got a call back from the GM, Irit. She refused to give me a refund and told me to call Travelocity. I called them and they gave me a refund for my room. The GM doesn't have a voicemail, by the way. Just call the hotel to make your reservation and by the person answering the phone you will be able to tell you don't want to stay there unless you like being treated extremely poorly. The rooms are unsafe for a single, female traveling alone. It is a motel style hotel and very loud, with extremely thin walls. Save yourself a headache.. don't stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm, beware of hidden charges and somewhat dirty rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jeffnraven
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sky Hotel at the beginning of March, 2008. It was a cute looking place once you pulled in off of the street. It had a nice little courtyard, and give off kind of a motel feel (not exactly what we like to stay in, but we love boutique hotels). It was obvious that this was a recent remodel. The front desk clerk was friendly, and helped us with our bags (there is no valet or bellman, this place is very small). The room was very nice, we paid for the Superior room off of their website, and got a deal because of our AAA membership. It was very modern, with a sexy looking headboard, marble floors, a pedestal sink, and other amenities. It was nice not paying for internet or parking, as this is standard in LA to pay up to 25.00 per day to park your car. The one thing we did notice was that the housekeeping staff did not pay too close of attention to the room. We found dirty socks in the wardrobe, an old shoe box that someone had left behind, toilet paper floating in the toilet, and crusty soap in the shower. Also, because the shower is a fiberglass resin material, it had dirt stains in it from previous guests. Unfortunately we did not take any pictures of this as we had a very busy few days in LA. We stayed three days and checked out to go home. The original room rate was reasonably priced (about 680.00 for the three days). The hotel did not seem very full at all, so it was very quiet the entire time we were there. Plus it was close to Westwood Village and the freeway which was convenient. Here is where the issues came in. Upon checking our account, we discovered an additional 150.00 in charges tacked on a few days after we left. When we called to inquire about the extra fees, we were told that my wife's hair had stained some towels and a robe (her hair is colored, and the color runs when she takes a shower). Now, these are garden variety white towels, but never in all of the years we have been traveling have we run into this issue. We were told that the towels were sent to the laundry, but they were not able to get the stains out. Have these people ever heard of bleach? My wife has had colored hair for seven years, and we have NEVER had this issue. We even brought it up to the hotel staff of a place that we have stayed at, and they said it was no problem. I think 150.00 for four towels and a robe is quite ridiculous, considering there was no notice of the additional charges. The management of this hotel seems very new, and a bit inexperienced in dealing with guests. The other thing we noticed is that the day clerk never bothered to ask how our stay was when we checked out. We are not the type of people to complain about a room, but if someone asks us a question, we will give them an honest answer. Granted this situation is unusual, as most people who surf this site probably will not face a towel replacement charge due to colored hair, but please be aware of the condition of the rooms. Had the hotel staff taken an extra 10 minutes to double check the room, many of these issues could have been corrected before we checked in. There are less than 30 rooms, and most of them were empty, how long could that possibly take? In closing, we will never stay in this hotel again, and intend to write a letter to the owners to apprise them of the situation we encountered..

Reviews.Title: “Motel trying to be boutique”
Reviews.Author: ALadyNomad
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the negative comments made, bring ear plugs, confirm your rate, bad service staff, A/C not working well, and modern decor (not quality decor). This is a converted motel. They are trying to disguise it as a boutique hotel. The location is why I chose this particular hotel. The "special" rate was 219.00 per night which isn't inexpensive. Rates are generally higher. The bed was nicely done as well as a flat panel tv. It could have been a little cleaner as there was still loose hair form the previous client. All in all I wouldn't stay again, but there's not much choice in that area. If I were a tourist I'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden little gem”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Toronto
Reviews.Content: This quaint small place was once a motel and is now a slate roofed, completely updated and perfectly clean hotel. With a boutique feel and a quiet central courtyard we enjoyed our stay immensely. The staff is wonderful and they prepared an assortment of light breakfast items and fresh bodums of coffee or espresso each morning. I would make a tray of croissant, cereals, cheeses, juice and biscotti to take on a tray back to my room for breakfast in bed. There were plenty of channels on the plasma television and the ethernet cabled internet was lightning fast. So much care and attention were paid to restoring/reviving this establishment. The location was great but Westwood does have traffic and I would imagine that the couple of rooms that front the street might be a bit loud. The second floor units have walkways directly in front of your room's window. I think they could put some sheer blind inside the curtain for those units so you can receive the light and maintain privacy. Maybe a main floor unit would allow more privacy as there are no walkways there. We found the hotel to be extremely good value and the parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “sky hotel..great choice!”
Reviews.Author: pjchinn
Reviews.Content: The Sky Hotel is an affordable very modern hotel just a few miles from Beverly Hills. The facility has just underwent a major renovation that has left if very clean, swank, and comfortable. The bathrooms are large and all the fixtures were new. Our first room did not have a mini fridge but becuase the a/c was on the blink we were upgraded to a delux room w/mini fridge. The continental breakfast comprises of great gourmet foods and great gourmet coffee. Nick was awesome and extremely helpfull....absolutely a full service hotel. The rooms and lobby look exactly like the photo's so what you see is exactly what you get..no gimmicks at all! The courtyard is also very nice and comfortable with all new furniture and tile flooring. Great for couples...we were celebrating our anniversary and had a great time..no noise problems at all! if you're going into BH take Olympic to Beverly Dr for less congestion...Two Thumbs way up!

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: OftenContentFlyer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Sky Hotel. It is brand new, and the staff is outstanding, really friendly and helpful. The room I had was great, no complaints about it's size, it had a small fridge and large bathroom. It was quiet, rarely heard another guest. The location is a little off the beaten path, but it's a short drive to Culver City, which apparently now has a restaurant scene! There were some slight issues with the air conditioning, but I'm sure they'll get sorted out. In a sea of sameness, the Sky Hotel really stands out.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Some ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: nola75
Reviews.Content: Looks can be deceiving. It looks like a dump from the outside (it obviously is a former cheap motel) but is actually quite nice and modern on the inside. All of the small rooms surround a courtyard and windows either face the courtyard, the alley or Westwood Blvd. Not sure which is better. The walls are paper thin. You can hear everything that goes in the courtyard and the rooms next to yours. My neighbor came home at 2am and I heard his entire phone conversation loud and clear. On the positive; bathrooms are large and recently renovated. Nice flat screen tv. Only stay here if you need a place to get a few hours sleep and are expecting nothing else. It doesnt offer anything.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Allagio!”
Reviews.Author: watsonsi
Reviews.Content: I booked my grandparents for a week at the Allagio and it was perfect. There is a nice continental breakfast brought to the rooms every morning (you choose when) The room was clean and neat. The beds were a little low - not equiped for people who have a hard time getting up but otherwise are fine. The service here was excellent. The staff would bendover backwards for you..just ask...Free of charge they would pick up a newspaper every morning for my grandpa. Always there to help. The dryer takes too long but it's nice for 5.00 you can do as many loads as you like and they provide detergents. There is a quaint little courtyard. Perfect for breakfast/reading in the sun. The hotel is centrally located. A resonable priced cab ride to either the Getty Museum, Museum Square, Sunset strip, Rodeo drive. Across the street is Juniors a nice deli with awesome brunch! Around the corner in walking distance is the Westside Pavillion Mall and Apple Pan(greatest little diner with an amazing Hickory Cheese Burger) There was little noise the week we stayed. The street, Westwood Blvd can get busy between 9AM-9PM so expect to hear traffic. I did a lot of searching and in comparison the hotel was a great deal. We would stay here again definitly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: CGBJ
Reviews.Content: We changed another booking in we had in Hollywood to this property located in Westwood - a great area of LA (much better than the very seedy Hollywood). It is close to a large shopping centre (walking distance), and close to cinemas, restaurants, easy to get to the many sights around LA that a tourist wishes to see. The property was new, clean, bright, had free internet access for guests, provided a great breakfast each day. Parking is free and always available. EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “The Pitts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience I have ever had in all my years of travel. The service was not only non exsistant, but the manager had every excuse in the book why she did not service my room. I would not stay here again unless the management has changed. I would also recommend that you try any other lodging available. When I disputed the charges on my credit card their response was a blatant lie. BEWARE! BEWARNED!

Reviews.Title: “Not royal but royal service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice mainly for the inexpensive price as well but the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. They also remembered me from the first time I stayed there. The staff is always up late at night if you come home late and have to give notice for a wake-up call. Rooms aren't fancy but quite adequate and quiet. You can actually hear water trickling from a nearby water fountain. They also have lots of free parking; a real benefit which most hotels don't have available. As one other reviewer said there's always a vacancy which is a benefit. It's in a great location only 2 miles from UCLA and Santa Monica. I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Royal It's Not”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here quite a few times. Mainly for the price ($53.00). When I first stayed there in 2000, it was pretty grimy, but hell, it's what you paid for. I've been there in the past month (2002) and the rooms are quite nicer than before, but only certain rooms. There's not much for you to do in the area as far as walking distance. There's the mall, but if you've decided to stay at the Royal Westwood Motel for saving money then shopping is that last thing on your mind. All the food places are out of walking distance. There's a Subway a few blocks north along with a tiny plaza. There's a TV with no cable and a continental breakfast -- coffee. I like it there, because there's always a vacancy. I'm a writer so I find it very peaceful. Oh, there's just one more thing. Sometimes at night they like to call you from the office which really grates on me. This is not during the day but at night around 11 PM. I always unplug the phone. I have a cell anyway. Anyway, it's just a place to crash.

HotelInfo.Name: Sky Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2352 Westwood Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90064
